metadata.topic_title: System and Information Integrity (NIST SI Family)

active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the relative priority of SI-2 Flaw Remediation versus SI-3 Malicious Code Protection in addressing modern cyber threats like ransomware. Support your position with real-world examples (e.g., Log4Shell vulnerability) and propose how they integrate with NIST CSF DE.AE (Adversarial Events).
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in NIST frameworks. Generate 40-50 high-quality flashcards on 'System and Information Integrity (NIST SI Family)' in Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Policy Development > Policy Content and Types > Operational Security Policies > System and Information Integrity (NIST SI Family). Incorporate these exactly: - Learning Objectives: [insert full list above] - Active Learning: Use elements to inspire scenario-based cards. - Scaffolding: Distribute flashcards: 10 Layer 1, 12 Layer 2, 12 Layer 3, 10-15 Layer 4. - Full accurate SI controls from NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5: SI-1 Policy and Procedures; SI-2 Flaw Remediation; SI-3 Malicious Code Protection; SI-4 System Monitoring; SI-5 Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives; SI-6 Security Function Verification; SI-7 Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity; SI-8 Spam Protection; SI-9 Information Input Validation; SI-10 Information Input Restrictions; SI-11 Error Handling; SI-12 Information Management and Retention. Include enhancements and CSF mappings (e.g., DE.CM). - Bloom's progression: Balance across levels. Use Flashcard Schema exactly: JSON array of objects with 'front', 'back' (answer, explanation, reference, example), 'bloom_level', 'scaffolding_layer', 'tags' (e.g., ['SI-2', 'APPLY']). Ensure active recall, no hints on front, plausible distractors for MCQs, web-grounded accuracy (cite NIST sources). Output only the JSON array.
